descriptionSet.description: A poster of Lord Vishnu by artist Anant Shivaji Desai depicts Vishnu holding a lotus and a gada (a type of club with a round head) and standing on a type of island in an ocean. In his two other hands, he holds a chakra (discus) and a conch. He has a halo and wears a flower garland, jewellery and a crown with peacock feathers.

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

rights.text: Copyrighted. Copyright with the original artists and publishers.

hra:item.hra:value: description-en: A poster of Lord Vishnu by artist Anant Shivaji Desai depicts Vishnu holding a lotus and a gada (a type of club with a round head) and standing on a type of island in an ocean. In his two other hands, he holds a chakra (discus) and a conch. He has a halo and wears a flower garland, jewellery and a crown with peacock feathers. (sp)
text-en: REGISTERED No. 769
text-en: Ravi Varma Press, Malavli, G.I.P
text-hi: श्री विष्णु
text-hi: मोतीबाज़ार मुंबई
text-hi: अनंत शिवाजी देसाई
text-transcription-hi: Motibazaar Mumbai
text-transcription-hi: Anant Shivaji Desai
text-transcription-hi: Sri Vishnu
explanatory comments/crosstagging: Note that attempt to show “India,” if only as a suggestive outline, on the partly-submerged globe on which Vishnu rests his divine feet. (Sumathi Ramaswamy)(gs)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: In the famous Ravi Varma Press’s Shri Vishnu, the four-armed smiling deity stands on a terrestrial globe on which the partial cartographic outline of India provides the resting place for his feet. (Sumathi Ramaswamy)(gs)
related literature: Menon, V.P. 1956. The Story of the Integration of the Indian States. New York: Macmillan. (gs)
related literature: Nair, P. Thankappan. 1987. Indian National Songs and Symbols. Calcutta: Firma KLM Pvt. Ltd, pp. 74-97. (gs)
related literature: Neumayer, Erwin, and Christine Schelberger. 2008."Bharat mata : India's freedom movement in popular art". Delhi: Oxford University Press. (gs)
related literature: Ramaswamy, Sumathi 2010. The Goddess and the Nation. Mapping Mother India. London: Duke University Press. (gs)

related literature: Ramaswamy, Sumathi 2011. "Artful Mapping in Bazaar India. Cartographic Reflections on the Priya Paul Collection". http://www.tasveergharindia.net/cmsdesk/essay/116/index_1.html last accessed 2011-03-30 (gs)
